content.description: Climb up the right side of the nose

Two moves of fragile rock lead to pockets in excellent rock. Fight hard direct or come in from the left with style. Three sections of interesting climbing with slight breaks in between. You may find it pumpy for the angle.
content.location: West side of the Monument around the corner and down the hill from Stubborn Swede

content.description: One of the best routes of the grade at Jackson
content.location: The leftmost (of four) route on The Monument's south side.  Next to the Unclaimed 5.9.

content.description: Climb up the left side of the nose
A wicked fun mixed route on the arete of the Monument.  Head up the arete to a really good rest on a ledge, a brown tricam has a bomber placement here.  Then sport up to the finish.
content.protection: small to medium gear and a brown tri-cam, then 3 bolts or so to the top.
content.location: As facing the Monument from Pricker Peak it is on the striking arete on the right side.

content.description: Another fine route among the many quality lines of the Hidden Peaks area. Climb the middle of the face (left of Lothlorien and the tall tree close to the face). A tall first bolt gives you an idea of the spacing.
content.protection: 4 well spaced bolts with a healthy runount on easier terrain to bolted anchors. For those wanting a little more security, there are some horizontal cracks between the upper bolts and the anchors that take small to mid-sized cams.
content.location: Left of the tall tree growing near the middle of the face.

content.description: First 20 feet are vertical to a slight balancey crux then the angle easies slightly along with the difficulty.
content.protection: 4 bolts, plus a small/medium cam or two
content.location: Lothlorien is located on The Monument in between the arete of Naked Blade and the Unclaimed 5.9

content.description: This is a mixed line that has 5 bolts to help protect the face. You’ll need some gear for the dihedral seam at the top.
content.location: Around the corner from Naked Blade

content.description: Great holds lead to a tricky crux.
content.location: This route is located on the stand alone tower feature known as Boner’s Boulder. It’s the only developed route on this feature.

content.description: The second of the two detached towers of the Hidden Peaks.
